    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is executed on a new thread, it starts the connection with the server and when the connection is established it distinguishes between ping or normal messages. If if a ping message is received, the received ping's flag is set to "true" and then the ping thread is interrupted, otherwise the message is queued.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected()
        Getter of parameter connected.
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected to the server or false if it is not connected

      • setConnected

        public static void setConnected​(boolean connected)
        Getter of parameter connected.
        Parameters:
        connected - is the boolean that indicates if the client is connected to the server or not

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method establishes the connection and creates ObjectInput and ObjectOutput streams.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - is thrown when the connection attempt has failed

      • disconnect

        public static void disconnect()
        This class disconnect the client.
